page.title: 01Holbeach Hurn and it's block
page.content: The area is{rural}and mostly farm land.Most is{arable}but there is {horticulture}and{livestock}as well.There are three big farms, one village and some outlying houses and smallholdings.The fields are separated by dykes or hedges.The old sea bank runs through the block. It is called {Roman Bank}but was built by the Saxons just before the Norman invasion.The village is called Holbeach Hurn.Children from there and outlying areas go by bus to Holbeach Bank school 3 miles away.There are spinneys of trees,cover for wildlife, and several ponds and"pits".The lanes are narrow.Two cars can just pass but it is difficult to pass a bus or tractor.Most shopping,leisure and medical facilities are out of the area at Holbeach,Boston,Spalding,Kings Lynn, or Peterborough.
